heading: Thursday Night
text: Becoming cloudy, with areas of fog. Some brief wintry mix possible northeast and in the Adirondacks, otherwise rain developing, mainly late. Temperatures falling early, then rising through the 30s east, and through the 40s west. South winds 10 to 20 mph, gusting from 40 to 60 mph.

heading: Friday
text: Mostly cloudy. Rain likely, mixing with or changing to snow in the afternoon, mainly over high terrain. Chance of thunder south, and in New Hampshire. Highs from the upper 40s to mid 50s; temperatures falling from west to east in the afternoon. South to southwest winds 10 to 20 mph, and gusting from 40 to 60 mph, becoming west by afternoon.

heading: Friday Night
text: Mostly cloudy. Scattered snow showers and periods of blowing snow, mainly in the northern mountains. Lows in the teens to around 20. West to northwest winds 10 to 20 mph, gusting to 45 mph.
